黃狗毛.en: Cibotium barometz; golden chicken fern; wolly fern

黃皮樹了哥.en: describes someone who takes advantage of those who he ,  she is familiar with or is the closest to

上網代理.en: an internet ,  web proxy [written and colloquial]

九九機.en: a communication equipment typically used by reporters in the past to intercept the walkie talkie used by police to obtain information [colloquial]

多多事實.en: troublesome; overly demanding; to talk too much [colloquial]

奇難雜症.en: difficult and complicated cases [written and colloquial]

搵水.en: to make money; to make a living [colloquial]

斟茶認錯.en: to offer tea as a gesture of apology to admit one's wrongdoing [colloquial]

油水地.en: somewhere which offers countless money making opportunities [colloquial]

焗豬扒餐.en: literally: baked pork chop meal; describes a situation where a pimp brings in a prostitute for a client knowing full well that she will be rejected, giving the pimp the chance to introduce another prostitute and hence gaining more commission overall as a result [colloquial]

照顧自己.en: to take care of oneself; to look after oneself [written and colloquial]

磨爛蓆.en: to linger around somewhere for a long time; to have prolonged sex [colloquial]

苛求高.en: to be very demanding [written and colloquial]

蒲開.en: to hang out (in the usual place) [colloquial]

衰邊瓣.en: 'what did you get in for?' (a question usually asked to prisoners) ,  'what crime did you commit?' [colloquial]

跣一鑊.en: to set someone up; to trick someone [colloquial]

過檯.en: for a night hostess to move across to another table in order to meet more clients [colloquial]

閂火.en: to turn off the stove ,  oven; to turn off the lights [written and colloquial]

阻住個地球轉.en: to be in the way; to be a nuisance to others [colloquial]
